appId.description: The unique application identifier located within a specific application directory instance.

categories.description:
categories is not part of the FDC3 1.2 spec but we support tags in our own platform app structure and an
equivalent categories was added to FDC3 2.0 so we map it if we find it in an FDC3 1.2 directory

contactEmail.description: E-mail to receive queries about the application

customConfig.description: An optional set of name value pairs that can be used to deliver custom data from an App Directory to a platform.

description.description:
Description of the application. This will typically be a 1-2 paragraph style blurb about the application. This
should be plain text.

icons.description:
Holds Icons used for the application. The icon can be used in the OpenFin Workspace HOME, STORE and DOCK
components.

images.description: Array of images to show the user when they are looking at app description.

intents.description: The list of intents implemented by the Application

manifest.description:
URI or full JSON of the application manifest providing all details related to launch and use requirements as
described by OpenFin. The format of this manifest for this platform is OpenFin specific, but can be identified by
the manifestType attribute.

manifestType.description:
The manifest type which relates to the format and structure of the manifest content. The definition is based on
what is supported by the platform this application directory is running against.

name.description: The name of the application. The name should be unique within an App Directory instance.

publisher.description: The name of the company that owns the application. The publisher has control over their namespace/app/signature.

supportEmail.description: E-mail to receive queries about the application

title.description: Title for the application, Can be used in the OpenFin Workspace HOME, STORE and DOCK components.

tooltip.description: Optional tooltip description e.g. for a OpenFin Workspace Dock button

version.description:
Version of the application. This allows multiple app versions to be defined using the same app name. This can be
a triplet but can also include things like 1.2.5 (BETA)

contexts.description:
A comma separated list of the types of contexts the intent offered by the application can process. where the
first part of the context type is the namespace e.g."fdc3.contact, org.companyname.contact"

customConfig.description: Custom configuration for the intent that may be required by a platform.

displayName.description: An optional display name for the intent that may be used in UI instead of the name.

name.description: The name of the intent to 'launch'. In this case the name of an Intent supported by an Application.

autostart.description:
does the application wish to be automatically started when the platform is initialized. Default behavior is
false.

instanceMode.description:
This only applies to web views/windows. Default is multi instance. Should we aim to only launch one instance of
this application and only show the app even if the intent resolver ui supports instances of apps. If multi should
we support multiple instances and let the user decide whether to launch a new instance or pick an existing one
from the intent picker? If new it means the intent picker will not show the option to pick an instance because
the app owner wants a new instance every time. And if an intent is raised and just the id of the app is specified
it will always launch a new instance

launchPreference.description: Contains additional information related to the launch of an application.

private.description:
Should this application not be listed in OpenFin Workspace components e.g. Workspace HOME, DOCK or STORE. It may
be that this app entry is mainly for responding to intent requests and shouldn't be launched directly.

DelayStrategy.description:
A window launch discovery strategy that waits for the given time period, checks if a process has
a window and if so, captures that window and registers it with the Snap Server

delayMs.description: How to wait in milliseconds after process launch before looking for a window

FDC3VOnePointTwoAppDirectoryResponse.description:
The successful response expected from a FDC3 1.2 request when all
applications are requested.

$schema.description: The schema that helps guide the structure of the response.

message.description: Response message providing status of query

metadata.description:
Metadata that provides information beyond the url path to help identify the format of the response that has been
received.

HostLaunchOptions.description: Additional options that apply to the host of the content

disableMultiplePages.description: Should the host support multi layouts (e.g. pages). Assumes the default for each host will be used.

disableToolbarOptions.description: Should the toolbar options of a window be hidden if they are available?

hasHeaders.description: Should the header for the content be hidden

icon.description: The Icon you would prefer the window shows.

pageIcon.description: If this host supports multiple layouts what should the icon be for the layout (e.g. page) be?

pageTitle.description: If this host supports multiple layouts what should the layout (e.g page) title be?

title.description: If specified it indicates a preference to be used by this type of host.

url.description: If specified it indicates you do not want to use a browser window for this view but a platform window.

LaunchPreference.description: Are there any preferences you would like to apply when launching this application?

bounds.description: Do you wish to specify a custom height/width and/or x/y position that should be used when this application is launched?

defaultCentered.description: Should the launched UI be positioned in the center of the screen?

options.description: Are there any app type specific options you would like to apply?

NativeLaunchOptions.description: Additional options that apply to a native app

native.description: Launch Preferences related to native apps

arguments.description: Arguments are set as an array for compatibility with appAssets, launchExternalProcess and Snap.

snap.description: If specified it indicates the native app should be included when snapping.

updatable.description:
What can be specified when launching a native app. This is an array of named types to reflect the properties you are happy to be specified.
By default nothing can be set outside of the app definition when launching the app.

NativePreference<never>.description: Which Launch Options are updatable and are there any constraints

NativePreferenceName.description: A list of native related settings that can be updated.

Preference.T.description: A list of Web related constraints

SnapLaunchOptions.description: Additional options that apply to the app when used in a snap context

strategy.description: The strategy for launching and locating the application.

ViewLaunchOptions.description: Additional options that apply to a view

host.description: If specified it indicates wish to specify specific host settings for this content.

updatable.description:
What can be specified when launching a view. This is an array of named types to reflect the properties you are happy to be specified.
By default nothing can be set outside of the app definition when launching the app.

view.description: The option to override a few settings that are specific to views.

ViewPreference<never>.description: Which Launch Options are updatable and are there any constraints

ViewPreferenceName.description: The different type of settings that might apply to a view

ViewPreferenceUrl.description: Which Launch Options are updatable and are there any constraints

constraint.description: Is there a constraint that the platform can apply?

WaitForWindowClassStrategy.description:
A window launch discovery strategy that looks for a window whose underlying OS class type matches the given regular expression.
It will timeout after the given time period if no window is found.

matchRegex.description: A regular expression string to match the window class against

timeoutMs.description: The timeout period milliseconds after which the window search will be abandoned

WaitForWindowNameStrategy.description:
A window launch discovery strategy that looks for a window whose caption matches the given regular expression.
It will timeout after the given time period if no window is found.

matchRegex.description: A regular expression string to match the window caption against

timeoutMs.description: The timeout period milliseconds after which the window search will be abandoned

WebPreferenceName.description: A list of web related settings that can be updated.

WindowLaunchOptions.description: Additional options that apply to a window

updatable.description:
What can be specified when launching a window. This is an array of named types to reflect the properties you are happy to be specified.
By default nothing can be set outside of the app definition when launching the app.

window.description: The option to override a few settings that are specific to windows.

WindowPreference<never>.description: Which Launch Options are updatable and are there any constraints

WindowPreferenceUrl.description: Which Launch Options are updatable and are there any constraints

constraint.description: Is there a constraint that the platform can apply?

customData.description:
A field that the user can attach serializable data to be ferried around with the window options.
_When omitted, _inherits_ from the parent application._

__type_2.description: Information relevant to the Interop Broker.

currentContextGroup.description: Context Group for the client. (green, yellow, red, etc.).

providerId.description: When provided, automatically connects the client to the specified provider uuid.

customData.description:
A field that the user can attach serializable data to be ferried around with the window options.
_When omitted, _inherits_ from the parent application._
